Event.name: Death
Event.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe the death of a <fen>Protagonist</fen>. A <fen>Cause</fen> of death may also be expressed obliquely. <ex></ex> <ex>The machine was not switched off, but <fex name="Protagonist">Mr. Lavelle</fex> <t>died</t> <fex name="Explanation">of natural causes</fex>, police said.</ex>
<ex>To avenge the <t>death</t> <fex name="Protagonist">of a son</fex> is not hasty work, if he is to be honored.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the being or entity that dies. With verbs in this frame, the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the External Argument.
<ex><fex name="Protagonist">The goldfish</fex> <t>died</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Explanation</fen> expresses any object or eventuality that brings about the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s death.
<ex>The cat <t>died</t> <fex name="Explanation">of old age</fex>.</ex> <ex>The children <t>perished</t> <fex name="Explanation">from hunger</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Some measure of the event, generally frequency.
<ex>You know, I wouldn't want to live in a Shakespearian play; people <t>die</t> in them <fex name="Degr">a lot</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Depictive</fen> denotes the state of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> as the death occurred. <ex>I think he <t>died</t> <fex name="Dep">happy</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
<ex>He <t>died</t> <fex name="Manr">horribly</fex>; I won't describe it.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Result</fen> indicates what occurs as the result of the death of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
<ex>If we don't find something soon, we'll all <t>starve</t> <fex name="Res">to death</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the death takes place.
<ex>Your father <t>passed</t> <t>away</t> <fex name="Place">in his hospital bed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Time</fen> denotes when the dying or killing occurs.
<ex>Your father <t>passed</t> <t>away</t> <fex name="Time">about four minutes ago</fex>.</ex> <ex>He sadly <t>passed</t> <t>away</t> <fex name="Time">in 1962</fex> because of severe cerebrovascular disease.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the larger event in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> dies, i.e. changes from living to dead.
<ex>The pilot <t>died</t> <fex name="sub">in the crash</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Maleficiary
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An individual negatively affected by the death of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
<ex>Aww man, my dog <t>died</t> <fex name="Maleficiary">on me</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: death.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or fact of dying or being killed.

lexUnit.name: demise.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person's death.

lexUnit.name: die.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop living.

lexUnit.name: perish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: die, especially in large numbers.

lexUnit.name: terminator.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (slang) person who kills.

lexUnit.name: croak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (informal) die.

lexUnit.name: decease.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (archaic) die.

lexUnit.name: starve.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: suffer or die or cause to suffer or die from hunger.

lexUnit.name: starvation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the fact of suffering or dying from hunger

lexUnit.name: expire.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person) die

lexUnit.name: pass away.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to die

lexUnit.name: kick the bucket.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (s.v. kick) die.

lexUnit.name: drown.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: die through submersion in water

lexUnit.name: croak it.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to die

lexUnit.name: asphyxiate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: die due to insufficient oxygen.

lexUnit.name: suffocate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: die from a lack of oxygen.

lexUnit.name: suffocation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: death due to lack of oxygen caused by an obstruction of the airway.

lexUnit.name: mortality.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the death of a person or other entity

lexUnit.name: end.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: death; 'meet' used as a support verb

lexUnit.name: mortal.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: destined eventually to die.
